CatDescriptText: Mr. Joseph Nicholson, 3401 Charlotta Street, Lawrenceville, and Mr. Dan Akers, 632 Winfred Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 9, 1957, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe that licensed taverns are as harmful to a neighborhood as speakeasies and gambling joints? Why?" Mr. Joseph Nicholson's answer reads: "I don't think that they are.  The licensed places have certain hours of closing and therefore make people go home, whereas speakeasies keep the people up all night and they don't go home.  In the gambling joints and speakeasies they cater to all types of persons." Mr. Dan Akers answer reads: "Speakeasies are always harmful especially in raising families.  As for the licensed taverns, well, I've never given them any thought."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Joseph Nicholson, and Dan Akers wearing dark fedora, plaid shirt, and zippered jacket with light colored yoke, posed in front of exterior wall
